report.title: No-One Dies
report.author: PsillyBoy
report.bodytext: There is no need for blind faith when you can experience that in which you believe. /n /n We were to pay the Head a visit; before departing: two of us consumed a brew, carefully prepared a few days earlier: /n /n I had taken 14 Hawaiian Baby Woodrose seeds and crushed them, leaving them to soak in boiled water before straining the liquid through an old t-shirt Separating the none soluble, stomach-irritating fats, from the water-soluble psychoactive amide being LSA, the naturally occurring precursor to LSD. Shared the tea with one other person. /n /n I have some experience with the seeds and was expecting to peak in about three hours, to reach a mellow plateau from which I could soak in the surroundings. /n /n An effigy of Buddha meditated on the brew as it brewed. /n /n After a beautiful five mile cycle along the beach, we reach Hengistbury Head. We rise to the top as the sun sets deeper, casting fantastic reds & oranges into our atmosphere. /n /n The third member of our group ingests roughly 80mg of MDMA. /n In a place like the Head you could experience euphoria without ever adding extra chemicals to the swirling pool already you. We decide not to without ever making the decision /n /n One moment rolls on, before our eyes the intense beauty of day morphs to a beauty more subtle. /n /n In the moment. /n /n We lie a top the Head, a mellow plateau, sitting one hundred and eighteen feet above sea level /n Upside down, near the edge and all I can see is Sea, /n And Sky! /n And the curve of the Earth!! /n /n In the moment. /n /n The sky darkens, the wind chills /n We cover ourselves in a blanket plenty big enough for three. /n /n In the moment. /n /n The curtains are drawn back and we are allowed to gaze upon the greatest show on Earth, /n The Universe /n We look out from a point. /n We travel. /n /n In the moment. /n /n Three highs become one, then many. /n /n I lose myself in the stars, the longer I gaze upon them the more I see. /n The only times I slip back from ecstasy are the times I tell myself: /n /n Its happening /n Response: /n I dont need to know thanks, Im already there. /n /n Sitting here, writing this /n I am confronted by a memory in a different category to those recalling everyday experience. A memory less focused on what happened, more on what I felt. A memory that is crystal clear but open to suggestion, a living memory that I know still has the power to teach me /n I felt what happened, /n It felt a bit like this /n /n LOVE /n /n Im unreasonably happy. /n Im filled with the most intense Love I have ever felt. /n Mad, directionless Love that flows out of me as it flows in: /n It blows through me as the wind blows over /n And I have a feeling that, like the wind, its movement is circular. /n /n As I lose consciousness of my body, I too become Love /n And I move with it. /n /n Having experienced such Love, and all it inspires. I cannot doubt that God exists, /n For I have known God in his purest manifestation, God as Love: /n And so I realise that God is Love, the very same force /n That which inspires creation. /n That which creates creation! /n /n The Human experience of LoveGod, known to lie behind the words of the term Mystical experience, is both old & new, eternal & transient: /n It is a fountain that human beings have been swimming in and drinking of as long as we have been apart And we have always been a part /n LoveGod: /n /n The illicit truth of every Religion. /n A muse that inspires the whole Human race. /n The source of all existence /n As simultaneously spiritual and material beings, not only is our Consciousness born from it, Our Body as well. /n /n My hand is inexorably linked to thoughts of my hand. /n He is an expression of my consciousness, of its will to reach out /n To Touch. /n /n One cannot exist without the Other because: One and the Other are One and the same. /n /n LoveGod is a paradox, being every word we utter and the gaps in between /n Explained equally inadequately by Good & Evil, Negative & Positive, /n Simultaneously both and neither /n It is being in the same moment as becoming, it never began and it still hasnt ended /n /n And so we find The Human Condition: /n /n I grow within /n And on this strange world: /n An impossible tapestry, /n They try to unfurl. /n /n Without knowing what to ask, /n They question each thread: /n Does it start when Im born? /n Does it end when Im dead? /n /n I grow within /n And on this strange land: /n An impossible tapestry, /n Woven of its own hand. /n /n Dont search for the answer, /n For the answer will come. /n Stand back far enough: /n Two merge into One. /n /n And so we find the Human race: /n /n In our relentless search for the answer (which is so ridiculously simple no-one stands a chance of comprehending it) we have neglected the beauty of all that provokes question. /n /n And so we find ourselves /n /n There is nothing as perfect for now as the ecstasy of the infinite question: /n The eternal involvement of self with other; finding out without asking a thing. /n A passive exchange of energies, of information /n /n If we concentrate on pursuing the answer, as opposed to cultivating a passive acceptance of the fact that the answer is immanent, we do ourselves no favours /n /n First: We miss out on the ecstasy of the infinite question, in other words /n We do not gain full enjoyment from our involvement with the outside and the inside worlds; /n This involvement is to be marvelled at, celebrated, cherished and explored /n /n Second: As we dream of the most sacred thing, we neglect the fact that everything is sacred. /n This, combined with an unawareness of the inter-connectedness of all things, has contributed to the widespread destruction of our Mother Earth, Gaia: /n /n She is our Garden yet we trample her plants and slaughter her animals, we suffocate her skin with a layer of concrete, pollute the air she breathes and the water she drinks with our foul concoctions /n /n She is our Garden, the tree is our life and we still forbid our children free run of her fruits /n /n How I yearn for free run of her fruits /n /n The Hawaiian Baby Woodrose seeds I consumed belong to a family of Gaias fruits termed Entheogen meaning God Within: /n /n Many Entheogens having been helping Human beings find LoveGod since we first looked outside of meat for food. They are gifts /n First from God, /n Then from Our Planet. /n /n There is nothing less human about looking to nature for Mind food than there is about looking to nature for Body food /n Yet the former lies well behind in the acceptance stakes At least in so far as many Societies, with their Governments and Religions, are concerned. /n /n * * * * * /n /n The drugs had worn off. /n /n We emerged from the woods, into which we had retreated after our Mystical experience a top the cliff, and lay once more under the blanket. /n The sound of the Sea, its partner the wind thankfully absent, soothed us to sleep. /n /n I awoke cold & damp but energised & joyous. /n Climbing back up the Head in order to reach the warming rays of the morning Sun, I was sent two messages arriving as thoughts /n /n The first, from God, said: /n /n No-one dies. /n /n The second, from Our Planet, said: /n /n Its not too late. /n /n /n copyright. Sam Ross. 2001.
